TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LayoutDirection extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A class for defining layout directions.

remarks.para: A class for defining layout directions. A layout direction can be left-to-right (LTR) or right-to-left (RTL). It can also be inherited (from a parent) or deduced from the default language script of a locale.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.LayoutDirections Inherit = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.LayoutDirections enum directly instead of this field.")

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.LayoutDirections Locale = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.LayoutDirections enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Horizontal layout direction is deduced from the default language script for the locale.

remarks.para: Horizontal layout direction is deduced from the default language script for the locale.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.LayoutDirections Ltr = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.LayoutDirections enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Horizontal layout direction is from Left to Right.

remarks.para: Horizontal layout direction is from Left to Right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Util.LayoutDirections Rtl = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Util.LayoutDirections enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Horizontal layout direction is from Right to Left.

remarks.para: Horizontal layout direction is from Right to Left.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
